question_category.name: Default for Unit 1 Quiz
question_category.info: The default category for questions shared in context 'Unit 1 Quiz'.

question_category.name: Default for Intro_TeacherEffectiveness_Induction
question_category.info: The default category for questions shared in context 'Intro_TeacherEffectiveness_Induction'.

question.name: Question 1
question.questiontext: Several researchers have linked improved student learning directly to teacher effectiveness.

answer.answertext: True
False

question.name: Question 2
question.questiontext: In the research on teacher effectiveness, teacher competency is often mentioned. The research often focuses on categorizing the knowledge, skills, and abilities that teachers must possess to have an impact on student learning.

answer.answertext: True
False

question.name: Question 3
question.questiontext: What research has indicated that teacher induction programs can significantly promote teacher retention and reduce teacher attrition?

answer.answertext: Adult education research
K–12 education research, focusing on middle school instructors
K–12 education research, which we can extrapolate and apply to adult education contexts

question.name: Question 4
question.questiontext: In adult education, beginning teachers are often assigned to work in challenging conditions, such as programs that predominantly serve economically disadvantaged students, many of whom may have had limited formal education. According to research, how can beginning teachers who face such challenges improve their skills and better serve these students?

answer.answertext: By attending graduate classes in education in addition to teaching
By partnering with a more experienced instructor serving as their mentor in a teacher induction program
By keeping a teaching journal and viewing videos of their own instruction
All of the above

question.name: Question 1
question.questiontext: Which of the following responses is not one of the intended purposes of the Adult Education Teacher Competencies described in Unit 2?

answer.answertext: Identify what an adult educator needs to know and be able to do
Evaluate a teacher’s performance to increase his/her salary
Provide a foundation for teacher induction
Improve student achievement

question.name: Question 2
question.questiontext: Which response best describes a domain of adult education?

answer.answertext: A set of specific knowledge and skills that every adult educator must have
A broad area of activity that an adult educator must engage in to be effective
An indication showing what a particular skills look like when performed in the classroom
A collection of illustrations of what these adult education skills look like in the classroom

question.name: Question 3
question.questiontext: In addition to its domains and competencies, the Adult Education Teacher Competencies also provide performance indicators and sample illustrations that describe what these competencies look like in the classroom.

answer.answertext: True
False

question.name: Question 4
question.questiontext: Match the uses of the Adult Education Teacher Competencies (shown below on the left) with the role of the educator (shown below on the right). Select the most appropriate response.

match.questiontext: Inform professional learning planning within local schools or agencies
Inform professional learning planning for high-level instructional reform
Help direct new teachers’ professional learning
Guide beginning teachers’ own professional learning in an unfamiliar teaching context

question.name: Question 1
question.questiontext:
Decide whether the following statement about the Teacher Induction Pathway’s overall purpose is true or false.

The Teacher Induction Pathway is intended to support local adult education programs in building capacity to sustain evidence-based instructional reform efforts by accelerating the effectiveness of experienced teachers.

answer.answertext: True
False

question.name: Question 2
question.questiontext: The Teacher Induction Pathway was designed to meet three main objectives. Which of the following four responses is not an intended objective?

answer.answertext: Support master teachers as they serve as mentors to beginning teachers
Accelerate beginning teachers’ ability to use evidence-based instructional practices
Support comprehensive instructional reform efforts at the national level
Support programs in developing systems to support continual instructional improvement

question.name: Question 3
question.questiontext: Sequence the following six distinct but interrelated steps of the Teacher Induction Pathway in the correct order, indicating a “1” for the first step, “2” for the second, and so on.

question.name: Question 4
question.questiontext: Match the sample key activities of effective instruction (shown below on the left) with the role of the educator you believe is best suited to perform this action (shown below on the right).

match.questiontext: Identifying and removing potential program barriers (e.g., by providing substitutes or planning time)
Receiving feedback after being observed
Conducting classroom observations
Providing demonstration lessons of evidence-based instruction in action
Viewing classroom demonstrations of evidence-based instruction in action

question.name: Question 1
question.questiontext:
The Adult Education Teacher Induction Toolkit has three objectives. Which one of the following four responses is not an objective of the Toolkit?

The Adult Education Teacher Induction Toolkit was designed to provide tools that help:

answer.answertext: Beginning teachers deliver evidence-based instruction in their classrooms.
Experienced teachers mentor beginning teachers.
Instructional leaders guide and support the induction pathway as a whole.
State directors guide high-level instructional reform efforts.

question.name: Question 2
question.questiontext: The Adult Education Teacher Induction Toolkit provides four introductory briefs that are intended for all adult educators and one that is intended primarily for instructional leaders. Which of the following four information briefs is geared toward instructional leaders?

answer.answertext: Teacher Induction and a Toolkit for Adult Educators
Conditions for Success in Teacher Induction
Teacher Induction and Mentoring Brief
Evidence-Based Instruction and Teacher Induction

question.name: Question 3
question.questiontext: Match the tools from The Adult Education Teacher Induction Toolkit (shown below on the left) with the role of the educator(s) you believe are best suited to make use of this tool (shown below on the right).

match.questiontext: Leadership Guide for Teacher Induction (guide)
Mentoring Guide for Teacher Induction:  Guidance for Mentors and Beginning Teachers (guide)
Adult Education Teacher Competencies and related Self-Assessment (tool)
Two online courses supporting evidence-based instruction (tool)
Glossary (tool)
Annotated Bibliography from research on teacher effectiveness (tool)

question.name: Question 4
question.questiontext:
According to the preview of sample tools from the unit presentation, where in the Toolkit would you look first to find help with the professional learning need (shown below on the left)? Match the question (on the left) to the tool that contains one or more resources addressing that need (full names of tools are listed below, a-d).

a. Mentoring Guide for Teacher Induction: Guidance for Mentors and Beginning Teachers

b. Adult Education Teacher Competencies

c. Evidence-Based Instruction and Teacher Induction (information brief) and two online courses, Motivating Adult Learners To Persist and Principles of Learning for Instructional Design

d. Leadership Guide for Teaching Induction

match.questiontext: How do I observe instruction objectively?
How do I determine whether a teacher is qualified to serve as a mentor?
How do I prepare beginning teachers for being inducted into using evidence-based instruction?
How do I provide feedback to the teacher whose class I observe?
How can I find out what an effective teacher should know and be able to do in his/her class?
As a beginning teacher, where can I get help in developing a Professional Learning Plan for myself?
